column5: Gotta love a decent January Thaw. The best part about them is that fishing can be fast and furious or fish can be spread out. I like the sporatic action in which case you have to walk a river hole to hole or run to run to find chrome. I find this steelheading scanario more challenging hence more rewarding.It also keeps the crowds down a bit. Didn't use a single roe bag as steelies seemed to hunt down Bunny jigs in the stained flows. Saturday's Outing was also challenging as the temps took a nosedive. Edge ice and chrome was the order of the day for those who dared to brave the wind and cold. Glad to get out while I could.

Here's another that hit a white Riverwood bunny jig. Steelies seemed to be sitting in the runs and tailouts during the stained flow. This is a good indication that fish are on the move. This cold snap will slow them down so here's to the next thaw.
Beautiful, just beautiful. Thanks for the report.
Hey way to go bud Where is the place u went to if its not a secret Thankx
Nice winter stell you got there...great pics too !!!!
great looking fish good going  rob
Great photo's. Could you post a picture or two of those bunny jigs when they are dry? Thanks.  -Ramble
Awesome bows!!....Those bunny jigs look very similar to bead headed woolly buggers...hard to tell from the pics...
nice pics congrats on the good day   Dann
WTG on the steel Glad to hear your effort payed off
Where is the location you got those steelhead
Very nice.  Your hands must have frozen.

Wow...you are hardcore!  Great report and glad to see if paid off for you.  I dont mind fishing in cold weather, I just cant stand having to knock the ice off the rod every 5 drifts.  Great pics...some great looking steel there.
